raw_text:
Benitez deflects blame from Dudek
 
 Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez has refused to point the finger of blame at goalkeeper Jerzy Dudek after Portsmouth claimed a draw at Anfield.
 
 Dudek fumbled a cross before Lomana LuaLua headed home an injury-time equaliser, levelling after Steven Gerrard put Liverpool ahead. Benitez said: "It was difficult for Jerzy. It was an unlucky moment. "He was expecting a cross from Matthew Taylor and it ended up like a shot, so I don't blame him for what happened." Benitez admitted it was a costly loss of two points by Liverpool, who followed up their derby defeat against Everton with a disappointing draw. He said: "We had many opportunities but didn't score and, in the end, a 1-0 lead was not enough. "If you don't have any chances you have to think of other things, but when you are creating so many chances as we are there is nothing you can say to the players. It was a pity. "We lost two points, but we have one more point in the table. Now we have another difficult game against Newcastle and we have to recover quickly from that."
llama3.2:1b: Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez refuses to blame Jerzy Dudek for Portsmouth's 1-0 win over Liverpool after Steven Gerrard scored an injury-time equaliser, saying it was an "unlucky moment" for the Polish goalkeeper.
The loss marks a costly second consecutive derby defeat for the Reds and their third straight away draw.
llama3.2:3b: Rafael Benitez refused to blame Jerzy Dudek after Liverpool drew 1-1 with Portsmouth at Anfield, citing a "difficult" moment for the goalkeeper due to an unlucky mistake.
The draw was costly, as it gave up two points, but Benitez emphasized his team's chances and vowed to recover quickly from the setback before their next game against Newcastle.
gemma2:2b: Rafael Benitez blames an unlucky incident for Jerzy Dudek's mistake that led to Portsmouth's equalizing goal.
He acknowledges a costly loss of two points for Liverpool, despite creating numerous chances, but emphasizes his belief in the team's performance.
He looks forward to the upcoming challenge against Newcastle and aims to quickly recover from this disappointing draw.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez refuses to blame Jerzy Dudek after Portsmouth drew at Anfield.
He blamed it on an injury-time equaliser.
The goal helped Liverpool maintain a 1-0 lead, but the team lost two points after losing their derby game with Everton.
Benitez stated that there were opportunities and chances for the players, but they didn't score as expected because of poor execution by some players, which led to a disappointing result.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez dismisses blame for loss to Portsmouth after Dudek's error led to an equalizer.
qwen2.5:3b: Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez denied blaming goalkeeper Jerzy Dudek after his team drew 1-1 with Portsmouth at Anfield.
Dudek made a mistake by fumbling a cross, allowing Lomana LuaLua to score an injury-time equalizer.
Benitez defended Dudek, stating it was "an unlucky moment" and he did not deserve blame.
Despite Liverpool having multiple scoring chances, they conceded only one goal, which Benitez felt was disappointing.
The manager admitted the loss of two points to Everton earlier in the season made this draw even more frustrating.
He also mentioned that next up is a difficult match against Newcastle, requiring quick recovery.
opencoder:1.5b: Rafael Benitez, despite his criticism at Dudek, has been a diligent and effective goalkeeper in Liverpool's Champions League defeat.
Dudek fumbled a cross between Lomana and LuaLua and was scored on the same pitch injury-time equaliser, which was followed by Steven Gerrard who led the match with a winning side.
The outcome was disappointing but also crucially important as it marked Liverpool's first major win against Everton.
smollm:1.7b: Benitez deflects blame from Dudek by refusing to point the finger of blame at goalkeeper Jerzy Dudek after Portsmouth claimed a draw at Anfield.
deepseek-r1:1.5b: Benitez did not blame Dudek for the draw at Anfield, criticizing a difficult moment where he expected another cross from Taylor but ended up in a poor situation.
His statement highlighted the cost of two points and his frustration about not scoring despite multiple chances.
The next match against Newcastle remains crucial for their recovery.
tinyllama:1.1b: Benitez deflects blame from Dudek after draw at Anfield.
Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez has refused to criticize goalkeeper Jerzy Dudek despite his team losing a match with an injury-time equalizer.

Dudek was expected to head the cross before Liverpool forward Steven Gerrard scored, and Benitez stated that it was unfortunate for Dudek due to Liverpool's opportunities being limited by missing chances.
Despite the loss, Liverpool remained in first place in their domestic league standings with two more points than Newcastle United.
The manager will look to turn things around against the team they lost to earlier this season at Goodison Park.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez has refused to blame goalkeeper Jerzy Dudek for their loss at Anfield, stating it was "unlucky moment" and that Dudek should have anticipated the shot.
The match resulted in a 1-0 draw, leaving Liverpool with two losses and three points from their last four games.
phi:2.7b: Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez did not blame goalkeeper Jerzy Dudek for a draw with Portsmouth after Dudek fumbled a cross.
The match ended 1-1 and Liverpool lost two points.
Benitez said he was disappointed but understood Dudek's situation.
They still had another game to win against Newcastle.
orca-mini:3b: Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez refused to blame goalkeeper Jerzy Dudek for Portsmouth's draw at Anfield.
Dudek fumbled a cross, allowing Lomana LuaLua to score an injury-time equalizer.
hermes3:3b: Benitez not blaming Dudek for Liverpool manager, deflecting blame after Portsmouth draw at Anfield.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez defended goalkeeper Jerzy Dudek after Portsmouth scored a last-minute equalizer at Anfield, blaming the costly loss of two points instead.
Despite Liverpool's many chances, they were unable to score and eventually drew 1-1.
Benitez emphasized that recovering quickly from this match would be crucial as they faced another difficult game against Newcastle.
chatgpt-4o-latest: Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez refused to blame goalkeeper Jerzy Dudek after a late error led to a 1-1 draw against Portsmouth at Anfield.
Dudek misjudged a cross, allowing Lomana LuaLua to score an injury-time equalizer after Steven Gerrard had put Liverpool ahead.
Benitez called it an unlucky moment and defended Dudek, stating the cross turned into an unexpected shot.
He acknowledged the draw as a costly loss of two points following their defeat to Everton but emphasized that Liverpool created many chances.
Looking ahead, he stressed the need to recover quickly for their next match against Newcastle.
stablelm2:1.6b: Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez avoids placing blame on goalkeeper Jerzy Dudek after Portsmouth earned a draw at Anfield.
Dudek fumbled a cross leading to a 1-0 loss, but the goal was later scored in injury time.
Despite having multiple chances throughout the match, Liverpool could not convert them into goals.
Benitez acknowledged their missed opportunities and lamented the loss of two points.
They now have another challenging game against Newcastle ahead.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez refrained from criticizing goalkeeper Jerzy Dudek following a 1-1 draw at Anfield with Portsmouth.
Dudek mishandled a cross, leading to Lomana LuaLua's equalizer in injury time after Steven Gerrard's early goal.
Benitez acknowledged it was an unfortunate incident, as Dudek expected a well-placed cross from Matthew Taylor and reacted as if it were a shot.
He expressed regret over the costly draw, emphasizing that Liverpool had numerous chances but failed to convert them into goals, resulting in two lost points.
Benitez highlighted the need for quick recovery before their upcoming match against Newcastle.
